page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The area includes the villages of Bredgar ,Tunstall, Rodmersham Green and Highsted.In addition there are numerous hamlets based mainly on farms.It is a rural area, on the southern outskirts of the town of Sittingbourne, to which the inhabitants of the area must look for amenities such as shopping and leisure.Farming is based on orchards, sheep,and cereal crops.The major industrial concern is the Shell Oil Research Laboratories.Road travel is the only means of transport,mainly private cars,as bus services are infrequent.The M2 motorway crosses the grid but there is no point of access. Housing styles vary from a medieval manor house to 20th century estates. Three village schools provide education for children to the age of eleven. Few people work on the land;most commute to main Kent towns or London.
